content: Cleveland Rocks Domestic Partnership Following weeks of emotional debate on both sides of the issue, the Cleveland City Council voted back in December to create a domestic-partner registry. Now, starting Thursday morning, Cleveland couples can finally begin registering as domestic partners. Councilman Joe Cimperman, a main sponsor of the registry, said in an e-mail, "this is a chance for all unmarried couples who share a residence to record their partnership and celebrate their commitment." More at ... >>>http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid82810.asp
